page.title: 04Housing in Bridport
page.content: In the centre of Bridport there are many old houses dating from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. On the main roads most of these houses have brick fronts while the back walls are stone. Behind the main streets are a number of narrow alleyways leading to small terraced houses. This old part of the town is sited on the raised area between the rivers Brit and Asker. To the South-East and South-West of the old centre are areas of newer housing.To the South-West Skilling consists mainly of council houses and flats.To the South-East the new private housing developments of Bothenhampton and Wanderwell have virtually surrounded the old village of Bothenhampton.
